alert.note: Alert for New York City (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 3:33AM EDT until April 11 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NEW YORK CITY... The National Weather Service in Upton has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 7 PM EDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...New York City. * TIMING...Late this morning into Tuesday evening. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...none. * IMPACTS...rapid fire spread if ignition occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...These condition will likely continue into Wednesday, and additional products may be issued for Wednesday as well.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected or occurring. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels will create a significantly elevated fire growth potential.
